Posts.Content: Hi FiveJays I found my self in your situation a few months back my wife was Diagnosed with Breast Cancer in April and had the Lumpectomy to remove the lump 4cm and a sentinal node biopsy these result was it had spread to five of the lymph nodes she the had all of them removed in a second operation. The surgery then the results will determine what treatment regime they will advise your finacee to take My wife also has Ulcerative colitis and I was concerned the treatments would effect this but we have been assured it does not other people have even said their symptoms eased during Chemo and we have three children as well  She did not have any scans or anything like that until after her surgery which I thought was strange as well and asked the relevant questions She is now having Chemo x 6 and then Rads x 6 My advise is to write down the questions you need to ask and make use of the diary type book they given to you as everything seems to be a  blur for the first four or five weeks We where open with our Kids they are 13 , 10 and 7 and explained everything to them. You have a long rooad adhead of you both and if I can help with advise then please respond I am usally on this site oonce a day as I find it helps me deal with what iis going on sam173
Posts.Title: Fiancee recently diagnosed

Posts.Content: Am after some advice wife was diagnosed with BC in April 2010 had Lumpectomy first and followed by Lymph Node removal as it had spread then 6 X FEC-TChemo only completed four as had a really bad reaction to the fourth session and 35 Rads  Had her 6 monthly mammogram last week got a call from the hospital to return for ultrasound and another mammogram as they can see what they say are calcifications on the same breast as the cancer was Has anyone else experienced this and what was the result am now petrified it has returned she has had a bad cough for about three months now and they said it was viral Asthma and she has been on a inhaler I am now wondering if this is connected    thanks    Sam173
